result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 11:15 am 
INCLUDES 17CF881 AND 15CF312. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 17CF881: Cts. 2 & 3>>D&RI. 
In 15CF312: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 17CF881: Ct. 1 (Deliver Amphetamine/2nd & Subsequent Offense/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 yrs probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through with recommendations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 376 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Clark County. 
Adj: 11:28 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2019 at 11:00 am.

INCLUDES 15CF301 AND 15CF312. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
COURT notes motion from the deft regarding bond filed before Atty Morgan was appointed in these matters. 
COURT questions Atty Morgan regarding his client's bond motion. 
Atty Morgan states he is prepared to proceed with motion today. 
Argument. 
COURT questions parties regarding the reason deft was found to be ineligible for EMP by the sheriff's dept. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT MODIFIES BOND - $5000 signature with first $1000 in cash - ADDITIONAL CONDITION: deft must make arrangements for checking compliance with condition of absolute sobriety with Clark County Sheriff's dept, Clark County dept of Corrections, or similar program in Clark County. 
COURT STAYS modification of bond until court is statisfied that such compliance testing is available in Clark County. 
COURT notes all other bond conditions remain. 
State requests proof of monitoring be submitted to State/Court. 
COURT notes that is its intent.
